Class Bitboard

java.lang.Object
com.github.bhlangonijr.chesslib.Bitboard
public class Bitboard extends Object
A collection of bitboards and related constant values useful to perform efficient board manipulations, fast squares comparisons, and to mask some operations to limited portions of the board.

A bitboard is a specialized bit array data structure used in chess programming, where each bit corresponds to some binary information stored in a board (e.g. the presence of a piece, the property of a square, etc.). Given chessboards have 64 squares, bitboards can be represented by 64-bits numbers (long unsigned integer values). Data manipulation and comparison of different bitboards can be performed using bitwise operations.

  • Method Details

    • bitScanForward

      public static int bitScanForward(long bb)
      Returns the index of the first (rightmost) bit set to 1 in the bitboard provided in input. The bit is the Least Significant 1-bit (LS1B).
      Parameters:
      bb - the bitboard for which the LS1B is to be returned
      Returns:
      the index of the first bit set to 1

    • bitScanReverse

      public static int bitScanReverse(long bb)
      Returns the index of the last (leftmost) bit set to 1 in the bitboard provided in input. The bit is the Most Significant 1-bit (MS1B).
      Parameters:
      bb - the bitboard for which the MS1B is to be returned
      Returns:
      the index of the last bit set to 1

    • bitsBetween

      public static long bitsBetween(long bb, int sq1, int sq2)
      Returns the sub-bitboard included between the two squares provided in input, that is, the portion of the bitboard included between two squares. The sub-bitboard is a two-dimensional space defined by the ranks and files of the two squares. For example, if squares A1 and C3 are provided in input, the method returns only the following squares of the original bitboard: [A1, B1, C1, A2, B2, C2, A3, B3, C3]. All other bits are set to 0.
      Parameters:
      bb - the bitboard the portion between the two squares must be returned
      sq1 - the first square that defines the two-dimensional space
      sq2 - the second square that defines the two-dimensional space
      Returns:
      the portion of the original bitboard included between the two squares

    • extractLsb

      public static long extractLsb(Long bb)
      Unsets the first bit set to 1. In other words, it sets to 0 the Least Significant 1-bit (LS1B).
      Parameters:
      bb - the bitboard to compute
      Returns:
      the resulting bitboard, from which the first bit set to 1 has been unset

    • hasOnly1Bit

      public static boolean hasOnly1Bit(Long bb)
      Check whether the given bitboard has only one bit set to 1.
      Parameters:
      bb - the bitboard to check
      Returns:
      true if the bitboard has only one bit set to 1

    • getBbtable

      public static long getBbtable(Square sq)
      Returns the bitboard representing the square provided in input.
      Parameters:
      sq - the square for which the bitboard must be returned
      Returns:
      the bitboard representing the single square

    • getBishopAttacks

      public static long getBishopAttacks(long mask, Square square)
      Returns the bitboard representing the bishop movement attacks, computed applying the provided mask. It could either refer to the squares attacked by a bishop placed on the input square, or conversely the bishops that can attack the square.
      Parameters:
      mask - the mask to apply to the bishop attacks
      square - the square for which to calculate the bishop attacks
      Returns:
      the bitboard of bishop movement attacks

    • getRookAttacks

      public static long getRookAttacks(long mask, Square square)
      Returns the bitboard representing the rook movement attacks, computed applying the provided mask. It could either refer to the squares attacked by a rook placed on the input square, or conversely the rooks that can attack the square.
      Parameters:
      mask - the mask to apply to the rook attacks
      square - the square for which to calculate the rook attacks
      Returns:
      the bitboard of rook movement attacks

    • getQueenAttacks

      public static long getQueenAttacks(long mask, Square square)
      Returns the bitboard representing the queen movement attacks, computed applying the provided mask. It could either refer to the squares attacked by a queen placed on the input square, or conversely the queens that can attack the square.
      Parameters:
      mask - the mask to apply to the queen attacks
      square - the square for which to calculate the queen attacks
      Returns:
      the bitboard of queen movement attacks

    • getKnightAttacks

      public static long getKnightAttacks(Square square, long mask)
      Returns the bitboard representing the knight movement attacks, computed applying the provided mask. It could either refer to the squares attacked by a knight placed on the input square, or conversely the knights that can attack the square.
      Parameters:
      square - the square for which to calculate the knight attacks
      mask - the mask to apply to the knight attacks
      Returns:
      the bitboard of knight movement attacks

    • getPawnAttacks

      public static long getPawnAttacks(Side side, Square square)
      Returns the bitboard representing the squares attacked by a pawn placed on the input square for a given side.
      Parameters:
      side - the side to move
      square - the square the pawn is placed
      Returns:
      the bitboard of the squares attacked by the pawn

    • getPawnCaptures

      public static long getPawnCaptures(Side side, Square square, long occupied, Square enPassant)
      Returns the bitboard representing the possible captures by a pawn placed on the input square for a given side. The method expects a bitboard of possible targets, the occupied squares, and the square for which en passant is playable (Square.NONE if en passant can not be played).
      Parameters:
      side - the side to move
      square - the square the pawn is placed
      occupied - a bitboard of possible targets
      enPassant - the square in which en passant capture is possible, Square.NONE otherwise
      Returns:
      the bitboard of the squares where the pawn can move to capturing a piece

    • getPawnMoves

      public static long getPawnMoves(Side side, Square square, long occupied)
      Returns the bitboard representing the possible moves, excluding captures, by a pawn placed on the input square for a given side. The method expects a bitboard of occupied squares where the pawn can not move to.
      Parameters:
      side - the side to move
      square - the square the pawn is placed
      occupied - a bitboard of occupied squares
      Returns:
      the bitboard of the squares where the pawn can move to

    • getKingAttacks

      public static long getKingAttacks(Square square, long mask)
      Returns the bitboard representing the king movement attacks, computed applying the provided mask. It could either refer to the squares attacked by a king placed on the input square, or conversely the kings that can attack the square.
      Parameters:
      square - the square for which to calculate the king attacks
      mask - the mask to apply to the king attacks
      Returns:
      the bitboard of king movement attacks

    • bbToSquareList

      public static List<Square> bbToSquareList(long bb)
      Returns the list of squares that are set in the bitboard provided in input, that is, the squares corresponding to the indexes set to 1 in the bitboard.
      Parameters:
      bb - the bitboard from which the list of squares must be returned
      Returns:
      the list of squares corresponding to the bits set to 1 in the bitboard

      Parameters:
      bb - the bitboard from which the array of squares must be returned
      Returns:

    • getRankbb

      public static long getRankbb(Square sq)
      Returns the bitboard representing the entire rank of the square given in input.
      Parameters:
      sq - the square for which the bitboard rank must be returned
      Returns:
      the bitboards representing the rank of the square

    • getFilebb

      public static long getFilebb(Square sq)
      Returns the bitboard representing the entire file of the square given in input.
      Parameters:
      sq - the square for which the bitboard file must be returned
      Returns:
      the bitboards representing the file of the square
